content:
Hey guys! I've been contributing to rust for a while now, but I'm only now joining the Zulip.

I'm interested in solving the FIXME that's been in the stdlib for ages now: Add block-buffering to stdout when appropriate. To my mind this means detecting if you're in a terminal session (whatever that means on your platform). However, there was also some discussion in the github issue suggesting that it might be preferable to make it a manual switch https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/60673. Would this change be significant enough to call for an RFC, or is it the sort of thing where I could create a proposed design in a PR and let discussion continue from there?

I think this change can directly be a PR. Once you open it I there will probably be an FCP though. See https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/implementing_new_features.html for more information about FCP's.
